Class SavedProjects

java.lang.Object
InputCheck
SavedProjects
public class SavedProjects
extends InputCheck
SavedProjects is a subclass that inherits methods from the InputChecks superclass.

This class contains methods to find, view, update, finalise and do date checks on projects in Poised. The Poised class, which runs the main program, calls on methods from this class to perform various functions on projects managed by Poised.

Author:
Quinton Amos

  • Constructor Details

    • SavedProjects

      public SavedProjects()

  • Method Details

    • searchProject

      public int searchProject​(java.lang.String projectDetails)
      The searchProject method runs through the projects.txt file to find a certain project object needed.

      It takes in one parameter with string info related to the project and returns an integer to indicate the line number of the project being located.

      Parameters:
      projectDetails - either a project number or project name to identify the project object
      Returns:
      returns an integer lineNum to indicate the line number of the project in the text file

    • viewProject

      public void viewProject()
      The viewProjects method runs through the projects.txt file to view all projects listed.

      The projects are each displayed in an easy-to-read format.

    • editProject

      public void editProject​(int option, int lineNum)
      The editProject method is used to edit either the due date or the amount paid to date.
      Parameters:
      option - an integer option the user enters in main.
      lineNum - int lineNum returned by searchProject to locate a project

    • finalising

      public void finalising​(int lineNum)
      The finalising method finalises a project object by generating an invoice, marking the project as finalised and adding a completion date to the project info.

      It selects a project object from the projects.txt file, checks whether an invoice must be generated and then marks the project as finalised, and adds a completion date. The finalised project is then stored in a new text file called CompletedProjects.txt.

      Parameters:
      lineNum - integer lineNum determined by the searchProject function

    • checkDate

      public void checkDate​(java.lang.String projectType) throws java.text.ParseException
      The dateCheck method determines whether a project is incomplete or overdue and displays those listed projects.

      It takes in either an 'overdue' or 'incomplete' projectType string, searches through the project objects in the projects.txt file, and displays a list of overdue or incomplete project objects.

      Parameters:
      projectType - string type to specify projects listed (either 'overdue' or incomplete')
      Throws:
      java.text.ParseException - occurs if a date string is in the wrong format to be parsed
